result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Anthony Sroka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: with probation now on.

Defendant is allowed huber. Defendant may serve in St Croix or Dunn County as long as there is no additional cost to Pierce County. Release date March 15, 2017.
Concurrent with: St Croix County case 13CF357

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Anthony Sroka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 1:09 Defendant Nicholas Anthony Sroka in court with attorney Donna Berger.  Defendant Nicholas Anthony Sroka in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Neither attorney has any changes to revocation paper. Victim's rights have been complied with. Thorie: 91 days credit. agrees with recommendation of 9 months. Atty Berger gives argument and requests the court adopt the recommendation of the DOC, 9 months jail concurrent. Def requests huber. Court: orders 9 months jail concurrent to St Croix case 13CF357 91 days credit. judgment for any unpaid court obligations. May serve in Dunn or St Croix county if there is no extra cost to Pierce County.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Def pleas not guilty. Court enters a not guilty plea. Court: 10 days to file any motions. Goes over bond conditions with Def. Def to remain until he is handed a notice for next hearing.
